content.description: Interesting climbing, different than most of the routes at the Gallery. The anchor is set unnecessarily far back up a lichen covered slab, but one could easily use "The Walrus" anchor just to the left before the low-angle slab.
content.location: Located on the right side of the gallery, this is the first bolted route to the left (about 15') of the obvious "Cringe Chimney." It is just to the right of "The Walrus."

content.description: Sustained high quality route, makes a great warm-up.  Crux is somewhat height-dependent and involves surmounting the first bulge about half way up. Slab top out.
content.location: Located on Gallery wall, third sport climb from the right.

content.description: Overhung crack to the left of Group Therapy.  When crack ends, climb to the left or right (your choice) and top out on either Group Therapy or King's Jester.
content.location: Located between Group Therapy and King's Jester.

content.description: Another classic line at the Gallery, start on easy terrain and move through several cruxes up higher.
content.location: From Group Therapy, this is the fourth bolted route to the right. From the obvious 15 ft tall flake feature at the start of Deep throat/King's Jester, it is the next bolted line to the left.

content.description: Low crux. One move wonder. Fun first clip.
content.location: 5 feet left of the large crack near Group Therapy.

content.description: Somewhat sustained difficulty. Hard stuff seemed to be in the middle.
content.protection: 6QD + anchor. one bolt is very hard to see from the ground.
content.location: Its the overhanging jug haul just around the 90 degree corner.

content.description: Climb the face near the hanging pine
content.location: 30ish feet to the right of Crybaby Club

content.description: Start to the right of chemney about 6ft, after the last bolt there is a gear placement in a pocket, a #3 tri-cam , if you need it, may have been retro bolted,
content.location: about 100ft to right of Group Therapy,

content.description: Short but good, beginner-friendly for sure. Start at the bottom, climb to the top. Use the holds.
content.location: Furtherest left route at the gallery. It's the one with 3 bolts.

content.description: Start on the big crack 10 feet further left of The Walrus.  Go up through the vertical seam.  Bottom can protect with wedges if you need them.     Variation 5.10c: Stay a few feet right of the 2nd clip.

climbs.name: Group Therapy
climbs.fa: Alan Carrier + Co. 1989, FFA Eric Ulner 1989

content.description: Overhanging jug haul. A hold broke off the original line, increasing the difficulty. Keep an eye out for the no hands rest ~2/3 of the way up!
content.location: After you reach the Gallery, walk right around the corner and you will find this glorious overhanging jug haul. You'll know the line when you see it, if its a weekend you'll know it by the line on the ground. First bolted route right of the obvious "Squirrel House Crack."

climbs.name: Earthbound Misfit
climbs.fa: Lawrence Stuemke 1988 First Free Lead Chris Schmick 1999

content.description: Easy pocket climbing, leads to a crux pulling the bulge, and ends on a stint of slab.
content.location: Leftmost route in the Gallery before the corner.(Not the arete)

content.protection: 4 bolts + anchors. Easier bottom climbing is protectable.
content.location: Starts to the right of Sore Throat in the scoop and goes up through the overhang.

content.description: Pocket climbing, to a bulge crux. Slabish ending.
content.location: Immediately to the right of Earthbound Misfit.

content.description: First route right of the Minstrel
Set up a top rope and stem your way up the chimney
content.location: The wide chimney feature to the left of The Minstrel

content.description: The area receives sun almost all day, and is one of the first areas to dry out after a rain. The climbs in this area are consistently good, although sometimes similar in nature. Check out the area classic, Group Therapy for a lesson in pump or battle one of the areas ubiquitous bulges just around the corner on Cut/Sore/Deep Throat. Try to avoid gear sprawl on the trail here, as this is a fairly high traffic area.
